bill_title: provide for the recovery of certain expenses in an action brought by an appellant relative to the assessment, allocation, or distribution of centrally assessed property.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the recovery of certain expenses in an action brought by any governmental subdivision relative to the assessment, allocation, or distribution of centrally assessed property. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 10-38 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The sixth judicial circuit court may award a reasonable sum to reimburse a utility for expenses, including attorneys' fees, in an action brought to court pursuant to chapter 10-38 by any governmental subdivision relative to the assessment, allocation, or distribution of property if the governmental subdivision does not prevail in its appeal of the property assessment, allocation, or distribution. Section 2. That chapter 10-38 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Supreme Court may award a reasonable sum to reimburse a utility for expenses, including attorneys' fees, in an action brought to the Supreme Court pursuant to chapter 10-38 by any governmental subdivision relative to the assessment, allocation, or distribution of property if the governmental subdivision does not prevail in its appeal of the property assessment, allocation, or distribution.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the recovery of certain expenses in an action brought by an appellant relative to the assessment, allocation, or distribution of centrally assessed property. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The sixth judicial circuit court may award reasonable disbursements, including attorneys' fees, in an action brought to court pursuant to chapter 10-38 against any appellant relative to the assessment, allocation, equalization, or distribution of property if the appellant does not prevail in its appeal of the property assessment, allocation, equalization, or distribution. Section 2. On motion, the Supreme Court may award reasonable attorneys' fees in an action brought to the Supreme Court pursuant to chapter 10-38 against any appellant relative to the assessment, allocation, equalization, or distribution of property if the appellant does not prevail in its appeal of the property assessment, allocation, equalization, or distribution. The motion shall be accompanied by counsel's verified itemized statement of costs incurred and legal services rendered. No award for attorney's fees may be made for or against the State of South Dakota in the Supreme Court. BILL HISTORY 1/12/99 First read in Senate and referred to Taxation.
